references.reason: This foundational paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), which are central to the methodology of the current paper.

This paper significantly improved upon the original DDPM, enhancing their efficiency and image quality, both of which are relevant to the current paper's focus on efficient and effective purification.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper connected score-based generative modeling with the solution of stochastic differential equations, providing a theoretical framework and efficient sampling techniques relevant to the current paper's purification approach.

references.paper_title: Certified adversarial robustness via randomized smoothing
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of randomized smoothing for certifying the robustness of classifiers, which is the core method for certified robustness improved upon by this paper.
This work presented a one-step DDPM purification method, providing a highly efficient baseline which the current paper seeks to improve upon in terms of both efficiency and accuracy.
